name: SAFe Continuous Delivery Pipeline
title: SAFe Continuous Delivery Pipeline - Development Team Workflow
description: Four-movement orchestration implementing the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Continuous Delivery Pipeline. Standardizes development team workflow across Continuous Exploration, Integration, Deployment, and Release on Demand phases with measurable visibility and consistency.
purpose: Provide development teams with a standardized, governed continuous delivery workflow that aligns with SAFe best practices, ensuring consistent velocity, quality, and value delivery across all pipeline stages.
trigger: CI/CD pipeline initiation, sprint boundary, or explicit team invocation

policies: All pipeline stages must maintain visibility score ≥ 0.7 (70%)
All pipeline stages must maintain consistency score ≥ 0.7 (70%)
Continuous Exploration must include customer collaboration before feature development
Continuous Integration requires automated build and test validation
Continuous Deployment requires feature toggles and dark launches for production safety
Release on Demand must include rollback capability and monitoring telemetry
Team must track metrics for each movement and report weekly
metrics: Lead time from Exploration to Release (days)
Mean Time to Recovery (MTTR) when issues occur

handlers.name: Hypothesize MVP
handlers.description: Define Minimum Marketable Features (MMFs) and Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) for validation

handlers.name: Collaborate and Research
handlers.description: Engage with customers, architects, POs, and teams for collaborative research

handlers.name: Architect for Delivery
handlers.description: Design solution architecture for testability, releasability, operations, and security

handlers.name: Synthesize Vision & Roadmap
handlers.description: Create solution vision, maintain roadmap, define features with BDD and prioritize

handlers.name: Develop Stories
handlers.description: Break features into stories with BDD acceptance criteria and TDD approach

handlers.name: Build & Automate
handlers.description: Execute continuous code integration with automated builds and tests

handlers.name: Test End-to-End
handlers.description: Execute comprehensive test automation including functional, integration, regression, and NFRs

handlers.name: Stage & Validate
handlers.description: Validate in staging environment using blue/green deployment patterns

handlers.name: Deploy to Production
handlers.description: Execute production deployment with feature toggles and dark launches

handlers.name: Verify in Production
handlers.description: Execute production testing including production smoke tests and validation

handlers.name: Monitor Full-Stack
handlers.description: Monitor production systems with telemetry, dashboards, and alerts across full stack

handlers.name: Respond to Incidents
handlers.description: Detect issues, collaborate across teams, and execute rollback or fix-forward strategy

handlers.name: Release Features
handlers.description: Execute controlled feature releases using canary releases and decoupled release elements

handlers.name: Stabilize Solution
handlers.description: Ensure system stability with failover, disaster recovery, security monitoring, and operational support

handlers.name: Measure Business Outcomes
handlers.description: Measure hypothesis outcomes using telemetry and Innovation Accounting

handlers.name: Learn & Improve
handlers.description: Analyze outcomes using value stream mapping and apply relentless improvement mindset

movements.name: Continuous Exploration
movements.description: Hypothesis, collaboration, architecture, and vision synthesis for upcoming features and releases
movements.purpose: Establish clear vision, validated hypotheses, and architectural direction before development begins

sequence.name: Hypothesize
sequence.description: Define MMFs/MVPs and Innovation Accounting frameworks

sequence.name: Collaborate & Research
sequence.description: Customer visits, Gemba walks, market research with diverse stakeholders

sequence.name: Architect for Delivery
sequence.description: Design for testability, releasability, operations, and threat modeling

sequence.name: Synthesize & Plan
sequence.description: Vision, roadmap, feature definition with BDD, and economic prioritization
success_criteria: Features written with BDD acceptance criteria
PI Planning completed with team alignment

movements.name: Continuous Integration
movements.description: Development, build automation, end-to-end testing, and staging validation
movements.purpose: Ensure every code commit integrates cleanly and passes comprehensive automated tests before production consideration

sequence.name: Develop & Write Tests
sequence.description: Break features into stories, apply TDD and BDD, implement code with quality
success_criteria: TDD unit tests written before code

sequence.name: Build & Automate
sequence.description: Continuous code integration, compilation, gated commits, security scanning
success_criteria: Unit tests pass (100% of committed code)

sequence.name: Test End-to-End
sequence.description: Functional, integration, regression tests; service virtualization; NFR testing

sequence.name: Stage & Validate
sequence.description: Staging environment congruity, blue/green deployment, system demo

movements.name: Continuous Deployment
movements.description: Production deployment with feature toggles, dark launches, monitoring, and incident response
movements.purpose: Safely deploy validated features to production with continuous monitoring and rapid response to issues

sequence.name: Deploy to Production
sequence.description: Dark launches, feature toggles, automated deployment, selective deployment
success_criteria: Deployed with feature toggle OFF (dark launch)

sequence.name: Verify in Production
sequence.description: Production testing, smoke tests, validation, NFR verification

sequence.name: Monitor Full-Stack
sequence.description: Full-stack telemetry, dashboards, federated monitoring, visual displays
success_criteria: Dashboards show key metrics in real-time

sequence.name: Respond to Incidents
sequence.description: Proactive detection, cross-team collaboration, session replay, rollback/fix-forward

movements.name: Release on Demand
movements.description: Controlled feature releases, solution stabilization, outcome measurement, and continuous learning
movements.purpose: Release features to customers on demand with confidence, measure business outcomes, and continuously improve delivery processes

sequence.name: Release Features
sequence.description: Canary releases, decoupled release elements, gradual feature toggle activation
success_criteria: Canary release to 5-10% of users completed
No critical errors in canary population

sequence.name: Stabilize Solution
sequence.description: Cross-team collaboration, failover/DR testing, security monitoring, operations support

sequence.name: Measure Business Outcomes
sequence.description: Application telemetry, Innovation Accounting, hypothesis validation

sequence.name: Learn & Improve
sequence.description: Value stream mapping, relentless improvement, retrospectives, process optimization
success_criteria: Process improvements implemented for next cycle
